properties.areaDesc: Mono; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Northern Washoe County; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California; Greater Lake Tahoe Area
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 1 at 3:39AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* Unusually pronounced high pressure will build into the region
through today, bringing above normal temperatures and mostly
sunny skies. Temperatures today could approach record highs. No
doubt a great time for outdoor recreation or even yard work
you've been putting off.

* On Sunday a strong cold front will push quickly through the
region, bringing strong winds and snow. Widespread strong
southwest winds Sunday morning will shift to the northwest
behind the front Sunday afternoon/evening. This will bring
impacts for high profile vehicles and rough air for aviation.
Along highways 395 and 95, especially south of I-80, plan for
strong crosswinds and areas of blowing dust. This includes
Walker Lake and Mono County, where very dry air along with
strong winds may also create localized critical fire weather
conditions.

* A brief period of higher intensity snow is also likely during
the day Sunday, which may cause travel impacts on roadways
including across Sierra passes. Road impacts in Western Nevada
cities remains more uncertain due to warm ground temperatures.
However, don't be surprised if there are slick roads coming home
from Sunday afternoon gatherings. Icy spots on roadways could
linger into Monday morning.

* Monday and Tuesday will be cold, certainly compared to what
we've seen recently. Temperatures Monday will be about 30
degrees colder versus highs this afternoon. Brisk north winds
will remind us all that it is still winter. Snow showers are
possible in this cold airmass, including lake effect snow
squalls south of Pyramid, Tahoe, and Walker Lakes. This could
affect travel on I-80 between Reno and Fernley during the Monday
morning commute.
